result.execSummary:
The defendant TRAVIS FAY FARMER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant TRAVIS FAY FARMER in court, in custody. 
Defendant waives counsel.
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Amended Ct. 1 (M): Defendant enters no contest plea.
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders: 
60 days jail - 60 days credit
Restitution: $649.19 plus $64.92 surcharge 
$443 
To be addressed on September 1 if balance is still outstanding, prior to Judgment being entered.

jail/671
Filed by Defendant, RE: Bond Modification - Sent for review
OSP Appointment of Counsel Report - 2nd or Subsequent Attorney - Sent for review

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant TRAVIS FAY FARMER in court, in custody.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for TRAVIS FAY FARMER. 
Attorney Schembera requests to withdraw as counsel. 
Court grants request. 
Defendant waives right to counsel for the rest of today's hearing but requests a new attorney to be appointed. 
Defendant requests a speedy trial. 
Defendant requests to address bond and convert it to a signature bond given the plea offer requests time served. Defendant informs the Court he has a cash bond in Eau Claire and is in custody on a sentence for Child Support.  
ADA Gay objects to bond modification due the defendant's request to a speedy trial. 
Defendant wishes to go over plea bargain with the attorney before accepting it. 
Court adjourns defendant's requests to allow the defendant to obtain counsel. 
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
From Defendant, RE: Bond - Sent for review

Preliminary hearing on May 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Linzmeier requests to modify cash bond to signature bond given defendant's custody status. 
ADA Broeren requests bond modification hearing to be set. 
Court does not modify bond at this time. Requests bond hearing to be set.

11:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant TRAVIS FAY FARMER appeared by video, in custody. 
To be recalled. 

11:36 AM Recalled. 
Attorney Linzmeier appears in court on behalf of Travis Fay Farmer. Other appearances remain the same. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 

Defendant is in custody on probation hold and has pending commitment orders for child support. 
Attorney Linzmeier advises defendant to waive time limits for a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant wishes to set matters for a preliminary hearing. 

11:42 AM Off the record for scheduling. 
11:43 AM Back on the record. 
Preliminary hearing set. 
Court directs defendant to contact SPD to obtain name of counsel. 
Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
